title.narrative: COVID-19 Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights, initiative
COVID-19 Oxfam-Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights Initiative

description.narrative: Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Defend and promote SRHR of girls, women and trans persons.
Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Försvara och främja SRHR för flickor, kvinnor och transpersoner.

The contribution ”Promoting Health and Sexual and Reproductive Rights of Maya, Garifuna and Mestizo Adult Women, Young Women, Adolescent Girls and Trans Women in Guatemala”, implemented by Oxfam Intermón and eight local partner organisations, during a period of five years. The Swedish contribution to the project is SEK 76,5 million and Oxfam Intermon will contribute with approximately SEK 3,5 million. The aim of this project is to defend and promote the sexual and reproductive health and rights of girls, women and trans persons in ten regions in Guatemala. Financially, the Swedish funds allocated to this contribution will be used for the carrying out of trainings on sexual and reproductive rights with girls and women; atention and the creation of platforms where organizations of women can meet and discuss common challenges and solutions; the provision of psychosocial care to survivors of sexual violence; to provide legal assistance and accompaniment in cases of sexual violence; and other activities. Additionally, the funds also target young men who have the potential to change the social imaginary and prevent violence against women. This will be achieved through training prossesses and through working with young male leaders from grassroot organizations who will, in turn, be able to affect and provide training to other young men. The activities will be implemented by the eight partner organizations and are estimated to benefit a total of more than 62 000 persons, the majority of whom are women. In addition, the project includes advocacy and awareness raising in order to affect institutions and operators working with justice, health and education on SRHR.

tag.narrative: 5.6 - Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences.

5.6 - Säkerställa allmän tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och reproduktiva rättigheter i enlighet med överenskommelserna i handlingsprogrammet från den internationella konferensen om befolkning och utveckling, Pekingplattformen samt slutdokumenten från respektive översynskonferenser.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The agreement with Oxfam was signed in March 2019. This first period of implementation has gone into preparation of the training program, methodology and developing the strategy of the advocacy area. It is premature to report results, but some progress is listed below: In the area of training process, (i) Initiated the training program with technical and strategic assistance: 3,514 of girls and women are empowered on feminism, gender identity, sexual orientation, SRHR and GBV among others. (ii) 3,514 women and girls and trans are more empowered on their SRHR. (iii) The strategy of the training process implemented, allowed the strengthening of the knowledge and capacities of training teams of eight organizations member of the consortium. (iv) eight women organizations are in the processes of strengthening their technical and administrative capacities in order to focuses on the areas that require improvement. (v) A global training plan for 8 organizations was developed to homogenize the technical content of the training program. Additionally, the advocacy plan was also developed. The implementation is part of the work plan 2020. With reference to the objective 2, (i) 139 girls and women received psychological assistance. (ii) 418 women received medical assistance;( 87 are women trans; 136 adolescents and 195 women). (iii) the partner provided legal, psychological and medical support services to 23 persons (women and girls/adolescents victims and survivors of sexual violence). 12 of these 23 cases of sexual abuse were presented in the Court. Sida approved adjustments in accordance to a specific proposal and budget submitted by Oxfam Intermon, due to the Covid-19 situation in April 2020. The adjusted plan, budget and Minute are archived physically. These documents are considered as part of the annual plan and budget 2020. The amount of the adjustment is GTQ. 2,491,432.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
